intro: Perezia ciliaris, commonly known as the silverleaf perezia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive silver-gray foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Perezia ciliaris is often cultivated for its ornamental value and adaptability to various garden conditions.
